summary: This is an FBI Special Agent's affidavit and application for a second search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street, filed on July 6, 2019. It details observations from an initial search that day which corroborated a victim's (Victim-1) descriptions of the interior, and seeks authority to seize evidence of sex trafficking crimes. The attached sealed indictment charges Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors from 2002-2005.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier and target of the investigation, charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. Owned and controlled the New York residence at 9 East 71st Street where the abuse allegedly occurred.

persons.name: Leslie Adamciyk
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent who authored the affidavit in support of the search warrant application, detailing observations from the initial search of Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The judge who signed the initial search warrant on July 6, 2019, and before whom the affidavit for the second warrant was sworn.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who signed the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which is attached as Exhibit A to the affidavit.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim of Epstein's sexual abuse between 2002-2005. Provided detailed descriptions of the interior of the New York residence, which were corroborated during the initial search. Also disclosed personal history including marriage fraud and substance abuse.

persons.name: Employee-1
persons.context: A New York-based employee of Epstein who, according to the indictment, communicated with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters at the New York Residence and worked with victim-recruiters.

persons.name: Employee-2
persons.context: An assistant/employee of Epstein who, according to the indictment, scheduled sexual encounters with minor victims in Florida, sometimes calling from New York.

persons.name: Employee-3
persons.context: An assistant/employee of Epstein who, according to the indictment, placed calls to schedule sexual encounters with minor victims in Florida.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2002, repeatedly abused by Epstein in New York, paid hundreds per encounter, and enticed to recruit other girls. Told Epstein her age.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2004, repeatedly abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence, paid hundreds per encounter, and enticed to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Minor Victim-3
persons.context: A minor victim recruited in 2005, repeatedly abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence, paid hundreds per encounter, enticed to recruit other girls, and told Epstein her age.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions at his New York residence when she was under 18.
Employee-1 was a New York-based employee who facilitated Epstein's abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters.
Employee-2 was an assistant who scheduled sexual encounters for Epstein with minor victims in Florida, sometimes calling from New York.
Employee-3 was an assistant who placed calls to schedule sexual encounters for Epstein with minor victims in Florida.
Epstein abused Minor Victim-1 repeatedly at the New York Residence, paid her, and enticed her to recruit other girls.
Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-1 in 2004 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.
Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-2 in 2005 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.
Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-3 in Florida in 2005 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.
Employee-3 placed a phone call to Minor Victim-3 in 2004 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Initial Search of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Law enforcement executed an initial search warrant at Epstein's New York residence, observing items that corroborated Victim-1's descriptions. The search was paused to seek a new warrant.

events.title: Application for Second Search Warrant
events.description: FBI Special Agent Leslie Adamciyk submitted an affidavit applying for a second search warrant for Epstein's New York residence, based on observations from the initial search.

events.title: Beginning of Alleged Abuse Pattern
events.description: The indictment alleges Jeffrey Epstein began enticing and recruiting minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his New York and Palm Beach residences, paying them in cash.

events.title: Abuse and Recruitment of Multiple Victims
events.description: Specific overt acts in the indictment include Epstein enticing Minor Victim-1, Minor Victim-2, and Minor Victim-3, and employees scheduling encounters with them.

events.title: Continuation of Abuse in Florida
events.description: Epstein abused Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 at the Palm Beach Residence, and employees scheduled encounters for that year.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (Epstein's New York Residence / 'Subject Premises')
Palm Beach, Florida (Location of Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Southern District of New York (Jurisdiction of the court)
Manhattan, New York (General location of abuse)
Upper East Side, Manhattan (Location of New York Residence)
keyFacts: The search warrant application was filed on July 6, 2019, seeking a second warrant for Epstein's NY home after an initial search that day found corroborating evidence.
Victim-1's detailed descriptions of the residence's interior (including busts, a taxidermied dog, and a massage room with nude art) were corroborated by FBI agents during the initial search.
A black binder labeled "PB Girls" was observed, which the agent believed may refer to minor victims in Palm Beach, Florida.
The attached indictment charges Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors from at least 2002 to 2005, involving dozens of minor girls as young as 14.
The indictment alleges Epstein used a network of employees and victim-recruiters to maintain a supply of minor girls for sexual exploitation in both New York and Florida.
